text: Bosch Digital is the digital heart of the Bosch Group.

We support Bosch businesses across
the globe in their path to digitalization.

But the key to that is actually people
enablement. And what we have organized

today in our office here
in Stuttgart in Germany is exactly that.

We are bringing associates of Bosch
and Bosch Digital together with colleagues
from AWS to learn together,
to exchange, tend to do a lot of hands-on

experiences
during the AWS DeepRacer event.

We also build up a lot of other events
where we had a combination

of a lot of interesting formats
like classroom trainings, webinars,

instructor-led trainings, exam preparation
sessions, jam sessions, and so on.

We actually also want
to create the practical formats

give the ability for people
to to practice what they learned.

And the third objective was to create
a community of continuous learning.
And for that
we use the AWS Skills Guild as a template, as a starting point

to really bring the experts together
to build up internally our cloud

champions that deliver the content,
but also bring the community together.

As a Cloud champion, I am actually helping
a lot of people get their certification.

I help them find
where the training materials are.

We also host different
Cloud Quests tournaments for them,

also jam sessions. And sometimes
we champions to do some interactive

demos and presentations on topics
including AWS services and other third

party tools so that everybody gets
a chance to skill up and level up.
With AWS, we found a partner
that helps us to enable,

educate, re-skill, up-skill our employees
because this is crucial
if you want to go in this new software business.

So I tried to find a way to do this,
not on our own,
and I reached out to AWS saying,

“do you have something in your portfolio
that can help me skilling up my people to

then be the best and trusted and most
trusted partner for our internal customer?”

And then they were like,
“yeah, we have the AWS Skills Guild program,
do you want to look into that?”
And then we just got the ball rolling.

Since the beginning of the Cloud Guild,
we see our senior leaders

encouraging more
and more people to participate,

so as a result, we see more
and more people coming to our events.

During the first six months,
we had hundreds of people attending our trainings.

We managed to build all this excitement
around the Bosch Digital Cloud Guild

due to the passion of our associates,
especially big

thanks to our Cloud Guild lead
and our Cloud Digital project manager

for making all of this organization possible
together. with our colleagues from AWS.
